New York City is bracing for a potential snowstorm next week, while the state grapples with healthcare staffing shortages, prompting a disaster emergency declaration; additionally, NYC's MTA faces weekend disruptions due to construction, and the city plans to expand red light camera intersections significantly.

### Risks & Alerts

- Potential snow storm expected next week; residents should prepare accordingly. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYDOS warns consumers about dangerous practices at med spas after violations were uncovered. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Most MTA subway lines will experience construction-related disruptions starting late Friday night. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxPcWFaRjNGcUxtUVY0SUcwaXVQd3ZRV2pUTVhvSnFpaXY0aG9RS3hLdFBXUXdFLXU0N2tkUWlpcnpPa3RwT2FzeXNHM0EtWTJYQ3cxWTBUX24zZ1k0Zmtqdy1jOW5DUGhJZjRyZ093SFNYTUlMNlJPSzg0enpNdVVSWHBfUDlabW9HaEE?oc=5)

### Civics & Politics

- Governor Hochul declares a disaster emergency in Bronx, Nassau, and New York counties due to healthcare staffing shortages.
